etymologies: late 16th century: from French platine ‘flat piece’ from plat ‘flat’

definitions: the plate in a small letterpress printing press which presses the paper against the type.
shortDefinitions: plate in small letterpress printing press which presses paper against type

definitions: the cylindrical roller in a typewriter against which the paper is held.
shortDefinitions: cylindrical roller in typewriter against which paper is held
